transcripts.text: Sarah Ashley Hunt is a hometown girl right here from Pittsburgh, and she's inspiring other kids to live for Jesus.  She's a dancer, model, and was recently crowned as Miss Teen Pittsburgh.  She also starred on Lifetime's reality TV show, Dance Moms.  Sarah, we are so happy to have you here.
Thank you so much for having me.
It's always exciting because you're 14.  Yes.  And so I love hearing your story about what God is in your life.  So tell us a little bit about where you're from and who you are.

Well, I'm from Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania.  I grew up born and raised in Baldwin.  I've been dancing since I was five and that's led me into what I'm doing today and Dance Moms, I've been on tour with Casting Crowns and just.  I've done so many amazing things and I think sharing the gospel with people and my Instagram, it just really has helped me a lot, tremendously.

And just even hearing you talk just a little bit about like, I think of like First Timothy, how it talks about don't let anyone think less of you because you are young and you are such an example of that.  So I wanna know, when did you discover your passion for dancing?

Well, it's actually a funny story.  So when I was like two or three, I would always dance in front of my TV at home.  And I would learn all these dances from like LazyTown and like this other show called Fresh Beat Band.  And my uncle's like, you should take dance lessons.  And I was like, I don't need to take dance lessons.  And then finally, when I was five, my mom was like, I see something there.  I think we need to put her in dance.  So she put me in dance at five.  just like a little recreational studio, like close to our house.  Like we did like one dance a year, like it wasn't anything.  And we had been really big fans of the show.  We watched every single season and I was a huge fan.  So she, I was like six and a half, I think.  And we like started again at the studio and she was like, I think we're gonna pull her and take her to Abby's.  And as soon as she took me to Abby's, Abby was like, you are mine, you're a ballerina and I'm gonna make you into something amazing.  And the following year is when I got casted to Dance Moms.  So it was like, my mom was like, wow.  Like, cause she said the Lord really showed her she needs to be somewhere else.  Like there's something there that I can see.  And she said, you wouldn't be here if I hadn't listened.  So that was really, really cool.
So how old were you when you got casted into Dance Mom, the reality TV show?

I was seven when I started at her studio.  I was eight.  So I did one full season with her, and then I got casted in the spring.  So it was a bunch of competitions.  They were undercover casting directors and stuff.  But it was so amazing.

And what was it like for you?  Because, you know, Dance Moms, it's like a national TV show.  You're a kid, you know, being in a spot.  What was it like for you being, you know, cameras all around and they're following your lives and just dancing?  What was that like for you?

It was definitely overwhelming because I was eight.  But it was one of the most amazing experiences ever and I wouldn't wanted to have it any other way.  And it was so eye-opening to see, because for so long, seeing just what was on TV to being behind the camera, it was totally different.  You have to grow up a little bit to not be so reliant on your mother at eight years old.  But I think I matured from it at such a young age.  But the experience from it, I can't even explain how grateful I am for Miss Abby and the show because I wouldn't be here without it.

Yeah, I can definitely see from talking for you, you're definitely mature and being in that spotlight, you know, you have to kind of grow up a little faster.  I just want to hear, take us back a little bit about, because your faith is a big part of who you are.  So tell us about, you know, your faith and how you found Jesus.

I was five when I gave my life to the Lord.  I was at Vacation Bible School at our church and they were like, I didn't even really know what was going on at the time.  And they were like, you want to come out and come get your, come get saved.  Like, please come out.  And I, five, I didn't know what was going on.
And I like went out.

and they were like, okay, honey, like you're, You're a follower now.  And they gave me, like, a Bible, and I, like, didn't know what it meant.  But, like, seeing from then till, like, now, I can see him.  Like, not necessarily, like, when it was happening, but I can see now, looking back, every point of my life, him being right there with me, leading me through everything.  And even through Dance Moms, we... It was difficult, but we had him to lean on.  So that... with that and with casting crowns and it was it I've seen him in absolutely everything that I've done because prayers and he's made a lot of things possible that I never ended up thinking would ever be something that I would be able to experience.  But I'm so... As I've grown up, I've really matured into my faith because when you're younger, it's more like, oh, like, it's your parents or, like, whatever.  But I really feel that, like, this past year since Casting Crowns, I've really, like, matured into, like, my own faith, which is very, very...

And I think it's really inspiring that you're 14 years old and you're so bold about your faith.  A lot of young girls your age, they're not thinking about Jesus, they're thinking about other things.  But one thing, talk to us a little bit about, because you had this amazing opportunity.  I remember when we were talking that you've just seen through your walk with God that he has truly created a platform for you to shine his glory and his love.  And one of them is from Casting Crown.  So tell us how that all came about.

Well, actually, it's also a funny story.  My parents have been fans of Casting Crowns since 1999 when they started, and I grew up listening to Casting Crowns.  We were huge fans.  And it was always like, oh, Casting Crowns.  Every time we say them, their music comes on.  It's like the craziest thing.  So I had followed him on Instagram, and I was commenting on Mark Hall's stuff.  and he, like, would come and be like, oh, I'm praying for you.  And my little brother, who's six, is always in the toy section, and he loves, Mark Hall loves Avengers.  So we would always see this, like, Doctor Strange, I think his name's Doctor Strange, and he literally looks just like Mark Hall.  So I took a picture of it, and I, like, DM'd it to him, and I was like, hi, like... My name's Sarah.  I just wanted to share this with  you.".  And he sent back, he was like, I've been praying for you.  I'm like, you're praying for me?  What?  But that was like, I was fangirling.  I was freaking out.  And that was almost two years ago.  And then it led into, he was like, what do you have going on?  And I would tell him performances or dance competitions or basically anything.  And he was like, I'm praying for you.  Hope that you do well and all this stuff.  and then he was like.  when he announced he was going on tour He was like well you need to be my like celebrity guest at like you're the Pittsburgh City.  And I was like oh my gosh like yes like.  and he was like you can come backstage and meet the bands and all this stuff.  And then like one thing led to another and we like damned him We're like.  would it be okay like if she danced?  and he was like oh my gosh.  Yes.  Let's see.  I was like I What?  Because in 2017, when the On My Soul video came out with a single ballerina, I came to my mom and dad and I said, I wanna do this.  This is something that I would wanna do with my life and my ministry and my career with dance.  And they were like, that's a big deal.  But the fact two years later that it happened, it came into existence was so crazy.  And we had told him and he was like, let's do On My Soul.  And it was the most amazing experience getting to perform.  We performed in front of 20,000 people each night.  And it was, I was on cloud nine.  It was amazing.

That is truly amazing.  that Jesus, he shows that he loves you so much, right?  And that he's opening these doors for you to really like.  shine for him.  That is amazing.  really incredible.  And just hearing, you know, Sarah, like your story and just your journey.  And I know this is just the beginning of what God is doing and it's going to be bigger and amazing and more than you can even ask, think or imagine.  But just as like a young girl, you know, we have a lot of viewers out there that have children that are your age or grandchildren.  We want to hear from your generation.  What's it like to be a teenager nowadays growing up in this world?

It definitely has its ups and downs, but there's been so many different people that have messaged me on Instagram.  They're like, you've helped me find my faith again, or you've helped me, you've brought me back to the Lord.  And it's like, so like, oh my gosh, like I did that?  Like, I'm just like a 14 year old girl, like from Pittsburgh, like not thinking anything of it.  Like, I'm just like posting about like what I believe in.  And even like with some of my friends, they're like, you've helped me find faith.  And even with my dance teacher, she's a Christian, and we do a whole bunch of videos and stuff to different Christian artists' songs.  And a couple of them have reached out, and they're like, we want to post you.  We want to share this with our followers.  But I've had so much positive feedback from what I do.  They're like, you've helped me find who I am again in Christ, which is amazing.  it's been a goal of mine, but I never thought that like it would touch people the way that it has.  So it's like, it's so amazing.

It's amazing how God is using you on social media.  I mean, it's like, you know, you're like, I'm just some small town girl from Pittsburgh, but God is using you in amazing and beautiful ways.  And just like, even just talking to you, I can see why is because there's a light and there's a purity and a love that comes out of you that I know that other young people can connect with.  And what would you say if there's like, one person that's sitting out there, a 14-year-old girl or a teenage boy, what would you say about why it's so important to really choose Jesus and give dear life to him?

Well, I would definitely say because leaning on him is like the only way that I got through hard times with dance moms or with literally anything in my life.  So definitely like leaning on him and having him as like your wall to lean on, but definitely having like, I can do anything, like I can do anything I put my mind to, like I dream big and you go for it.  And that's kind of been what I've been like, okay, this is like what you're going to do.  Like you dream big, you can go do this.  And it was shown from Casting Crowns.  So I was like, wow, like if I like pray for it and strive for it and want it, it can happen.  But I always say, give God your best and leave the rest up to him because that's been my motto since I was five.  And it's grown with me and led me to where I am.

That is so inspiring.  Thank you so much, Sarah, for sharing.  And I just want to encourage you, if you have a child or a grandchild that's listening and they're a teenager, give us a call at 888-665-4483 because we want to pray with them, because we want to believe with them that God is going to take them to amazing places.  Well, you know, God has given Sarah such a beautiful gift for dance.  And here she is now performing to Casting Crowns song.

This is the story of a runaway with no way home and no way out.  I threw the best of me away.  I had my chance.  It's too late now.  Too far gone and too ashamed to think that you'd still know my name.  But love refused to let my story in that way.
You didn't wait for me to find my way to you.
I couldn't cross that distance even if I wanted to.  You came
running after me when anybody
else would have turned
and left me at my worst.

Love moved first.  What kind of grace, relentless grace Would chase this rebel down Crawl into this prisoner's cage.  Take my hand and pull me out.  You knew I couldn't make the change.  So you became the change in me.  And now I live to tell the story Of the God who rescues.  You didn't wait for me To find my way to you.  I couldn't cross that distance, even if I wanted to.  You came running after me, when anybody else would turn and left me at my worst.  From the throne to the manger From the manger to the grave Your cross is the proof.
Love made the first move From a grave meant to keep you To a stone rolled away.

Your cross is the proof.  Love made the first move.  I remember where you found me.  I'm amazed by where I stand.  Your cross is the proof That love made the first move.  You didn't wait for me To find my way to you.
I couldn't cross that distance Even if I wanted to.
He came running after me when anybody else would turn and left me at my worst.  Love moved first.  Love moved first.
